org.jboss.windup.graph

Interface GraphContext

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GraphContextImpl

    public interface GraphContext
extends Closeable
    Context for interacting with the underlying graph database API.
    Author:
    Lincoln Baxter, III, Ondrej Zizka, I

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • getGraphDirectory

        Path getGraphDirectory()
        Get the Path on disk where this graph is stored.

      • getGraph

        org.janusgraph.core.JanusGraph getGraph()
        Get the underlying TinkerGraph, which is itself a wrapper for a JanusGraph.

      • create

        GraphContext create(boolean enableListeners)
        Creates new graph using the configuration. In case there was already a graph located in the specified path, it will be deleted. If the enableListeners flag is false, then this will not enable GraphMutation listeners. These are not necessary for processes that only read from the graph and are only used for graphs that are used as part of an analysis.

      • load

        GraphContext load()
        Loads the graph using the configuration.

      • getOptionMap

        Map<String,Object> getOptionMap()
        Returns the globally configured options as an immutable Map. Example usage: 
         Boolean overwrite = (Boolean) windupConfiguration.getOptionMap().get(OverwriteOption.NAME);
